item.description:
Opening it up for anyone else who is interested.  My mother is a breast cancer survivor, twice. I used to run in Susan G. Komen races on her behalf while in St. Louis.  Now I'm continuing the tradition here in Rhode Island. 

For more information on the cause and the 5K, please see the following:

http://support.gloriagemma.org/

Registration is $30.  Rather than taking a team approach, I encourage anyone who is interested to register as an individual member.  Online registration is available.  Also there is no pressure on collecting donations.  This is all about getting together, having fun, and meeting up.  The $30 registration itself will likely go a long way.

Just FYI, you can get a long-sleeved pink t-shirt with an additional donation of at least $25.  With a donation of $35 you get a t-shirt and pink glove service:

(http://support.gloriagemma.org/site/PageServer?pagename=Pink_Glove_Service). ;

I encourage you to check out the perks.

On the day of the race, we'll meet up @10-11 am at the Rhode Island State House on the south side at the lower stairs prior to the race, and meet up as the same place after the race is finished.  I'll sport an article of clothing to be determined so you can easily find me.

You can pick up your number and goodies prior to or on the day of the race. 

Any questions, comments and/or concerns, please don't hesitate to ask.  Should be a fun day of running.  If you have anything to add, please don't hesitate to comment.
item.name: Gloria Gemma Breast Cancer 5K
